<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517

&lt;/xml&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;&lt;!&#8211; [if gte mso 10]&gt;</p>
<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517 

	———–

<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517

<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

	<style>
/* Style Definitions */
table.MsoNormalTable
{mso-style-name:”Table Normal”;
mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
mso-style-noshow:yes;

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517 

	———–

<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

	<style>
/* Style Definitions */
table.MsoNormalTable
{mso-style-name:”Table Normal”;

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517

&lt;w:WordDocument&gt;<br />
&lt;w:View&gt;Normal&lt;/w:View&gt;<br />

<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517

mso-para-margin-top:0cm;<br />
mso-para-margin-right:0cm;<br />
mso-para-margin-bottom:10.0pt;<br />
mso-para-margin-left:0cm;<br />
line-height:115%;<br />
mso-pagination:widow-orphan;<br />
font-size:11.0pt;<br />
font-family:&#8221;Calibri&#8221;,&#8221;sans-serif&#8221;;<br />
mso-ascii-font-family:Calibri;<br />
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;<br />
mso-hansi-font-family:Calibri;<br />
mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;<br />
mso-fareast-language:EN-US;}<br />
&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

mso-fareast-language:EN-US;}
</style><![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517 

	———–

	Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.

<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517

&lt;/xml&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;&lt;!&#8211; [if gte mso 10]&gt;</p>
<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517 

	———–

<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517

&lt;/xml&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;&lt;!&#8211; [if gte mso 10]&gt;</p>
<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

	<style>
/* Style Definitions */
table.MsoNormalTable
{mso-style-name:”Table Normal”;
mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517 

	———–

<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

	<style>
/* Style Definitions */
table.MsoNormalTable
{mso-style-name:”Table Normal”;

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517 

	———–

 <p>vanessa.todd wrote:</p>

&lt;w:WordDocument&gt;<br />
&lt;w:View&gt;Normal&lt;/w:View&gt;<br />

&lt;w:TrackMoves/&gt;<br />

<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517

mso-para-margin-top:0cm;<br />
mso-para-margin-right:0cm;<br />
mso-para-margin-bottom:10.0pt;<br />
mso-para-margin-left:0cm;<br />
line-height:115%;<br />
mso-pagination:widow-orphan;<br />
font-size:11.0pt;<br />
font-family:&#8221;Calibri&#8221;,&#8221;sans-serif&#8221;;<br />
mso-ascii-font-family:Calibri;<br />
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;<br />
mso-hansi-font-family:Calibri;<br />
mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;<br />
mso-fareast-language:EN-US;}<br />
&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p>Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.</p>

mso-fareast-language:EN-US;}
</style><![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517 

	———–

	Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.

<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517

&lt;/xml&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;&lt;!&#8211; [if gte mso 10]&gt;</p>
<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517 

	———–

<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517

<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

	<style>
/* Style Definitions */
table.MsoNormalTable
{mso-style-name:”Table Normal”;
mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
mso-style-noshow:yes;

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517

<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

	<style>
/* Style Definitions */
table.MsoNormalTable
{mso-style-name:”Table Normal”;

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517

&lt;w:WordDocument&gt;<br />
&lt;w:View&gt;Normal&lt;/w:View&gt;<br />

&lt;w:TrackMoves/&gt;<br />

<p>&lt;style&gt;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517

mso-para-margin-top:0cm;<br />
mso-para-margin-right:0cm;<br />
mso-para-margin-bottom:10.0pt;<br />
mso-para-margin-left:0cm;<br />
line-height:115%;<br />
mso-pagination:widow-orphan;<br />
font-size:11.0pt;<br />
font-family:&#8221;Calibri&#8221;,&#8221;sans-serif&#8221;;<br />
mso-ascii-font-family:Calibri;<br />
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;<br />
mso-hansi-font-family:Calibri;<br />
mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;<br />
mso-fareast-language:EN-US;}<br />
&lt;/style&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10517</p>
<p>&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8211;</p>

<p>Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.</p>

mso-para-margin-left:0cm;
line-height:115%;
mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
font-size:11.0pt;
font-family:”Calibri”,”sans-serif”;
mso-ascii-font-family:Calibri;
mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-hansi-font-family:Calibri;
mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-fareast-language:EN-US;}
</style>
<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———– 

	You are receiving this email because you subscribed to a forum topic. 

	Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>
