<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>
<p>&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8211;</p>
<p>You are receiving this email because you subscribed to a forum topic.</p>
<p>Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.</p>

</style>
<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

	Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>
<p>&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8211;</p>
<p>You are receiving this email because you subscribed to a forum topic.</p>
<p>Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.</p>

</style>
<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

	Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>
<p>&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8211;</p>

<p>Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.</p>

<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>
<p>&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8211;</p>
<p>You are receiving this email because you subscribed to a forum topic.</p>
<p>Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.</p>

</style>
<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———– 

	You are receiving this email because you subscribed to a forum topic. 

	Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>
<p>&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8211;</p>

<p>Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.</p>

<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>
<p>&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8211;</p>
<p>You are receiving this email because you subscribed to a forum topic.</p>
<p>Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.</p>

</style>
<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———– 

	You are receiving this email because you subscribed to a forum topic. 

	Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails. 

							this mail is brought to you by MailPress

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>vanessa.todd wrote:</p>
<p>&lt;!&#8211; [if gte mso 9]&gt;&lt;xml&gt;<br />
 &lt;o:OfficeDocumentSettings&gt;<br />
  &lt;o:AllowPNG/&gt;<br />

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520

&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>
<p>&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8211;</p>

<p>Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.</p>

<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———– 

	You are receiving this email because you subscribed to a forum topic. 

	Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails. 

							this mail is brought to you by MailPress

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<p>Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.</p>

<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

/* Style Definitions */

{mso-style-name:”Table Normal”;

mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>
<p>&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8211;</p>

<p>Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.</p>

<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520

&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>

<![endif]–>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. <span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”> </span>I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>I also recently completed my first MOOC.</p>
<p class=”MsoNormal”>I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>So I have two questions.<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).<span style=”mso-spacerun: yes;”>  </span>Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).</p> 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520 

	———–

  &lt;w:LsdException Locked=&#8221;false&#8221; Priority=&#8221;39&#8243; QFormat=&#8221;true&#8221; Name=&#8221;TOC Heading&#8221;/&gt;<br />
 &lt;/w:LatentStyles&gt;<br />
&lt;/xml&gt;&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;&lt;!&#8211; [if gte mso 10]&gt;<br />
&lt;style&gt;<br />

	{mso-style-name:&#8221;Table Normal&#8221;;<br />
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;<br />
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;<br />
	mso-style-noshow:yes;<br />
	mso-style-priority:99;<br />

	mso-para-margin-right:0cm;<br />
	mso-para-margin-bottom:10.0pt;<br />
	mso-para-margin-left:0cm;<br />
	line-height:115%;<br />
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;<br />
	font-size:11.0pt;<br />
	font-family:&#8221;Calibri&#8221;,&#8221;sans-serif&#8221;;<br />

&lt;/style&gt;<br />
&lt;![endif]&#8211;&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I work at an English Language Centre in at a university Sydney, Australia.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Our courses use a blended learning model, with class work extended through online activities. &lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt; &lt;/span&gt;I’ve also investigated many other websites on academic skills and academic English, in order to recommend good self-learning tools for my students.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;I also recently completed my first MOOC.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
&lt;p class=&#8221;MsoNormal&#8221;&gt;I’m not a techno-phile; my interest is in how technology can help me achieve specific goals (see Craig’s post, April 28).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;So I have two questions.&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Firstly, what is it like to learn online? (as mentioned above, I’ve already had one experience, and I’m really happy that ocTEL is providing such a contrast).&lt;span style=&#8221;mso-spacerun: yes;&#8221;&gt;  &lt;/span&gt;Secondly, what does this teach me about designing online learning activities for others? (Which activities might be helpful for achieving which learning outcomes?).&lt;/p&gt;</p>
<p>Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-1-big-and-little-questions/#post-10520</p>
<p>&#8212;&#8212;&#8212;&#8211;</p>
<p>You are receiving this email because you subscribed to a forum topic.</p>
<p>Login and visit the topic to unsubscribe from these emails.</p>

! [ocTEL 2014] Activity 0.3: Exploring and experimenting !
* ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ *
May 6, 2014



	Sandy Barker wrote: 

	Hi All 

	I have been a traditional forum user but an avid social user of social media. I have spent quite some time in education with Wikis and last year attempted a blog in one of my courses. 

	I have just started my own blog for this course and hope to continue once this is over. I will continue to follow forums as well but it will be determined by available time to spend trawling through the posts. I agree with some of the comments above in that is very difficult to keep some forums on track and focussed to make for easy reading 

	Post Link: http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014/forums/topic/activity-0-3-exploring-and-experimenting/#post-10596

 ------------------- text/html -------------------  
 <p>Sandy Barker wrote:</p>
<p>Hi All</p>

	Sandy Barker wrote: 

	Hi All 

	I have been a traditional forum user but an avid social user of social media. I have spent quite some time in education with Wikis and last year attempted a blog in one of my courses. 

	I have just started my own blog for this course and hope to continue once this is over. I will continue to follow forums as well but it will be determined by available time to spend trawling through the posts. I agree with some of the comments above in that is very difficult to keep some forums on track and focussed to make for easy reading

May 6, 2014



	 Your daily digest of group activity at ocTEL 2014 [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__445&utm_campaign=2014-05-06T05:00:10+00:00] Group Summary: 
	* Paul is looking for participants: Activity 0.2: Small group reflection [#paul-is-looking-for-participants-activity-0-2-small-group-reflection] (1 items) Group: Paul is looking for participants: Activity 0.2: Small group reflection [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__445&utm_campaign=2014-05-06T05:00:10+00:00/groups/paul-is-looking-for-participants-activity-0-2-small-group-reflection/] To disable these notifications for this group click unsubscribe [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__445&utm_campaign=2014-05-06T05:00:10+00:00/members/cwrycraft/?bpass-action=unsubscribe&group=2&access_key=a0309d45a8a9ebe80959a6b6dbdf22b1] – change email options [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__445&utm_campaign=2014-05-06T05:00:10+00:00/wp-login.php?action=bpnoaccess&auth=1&redirect_to=http%3A%2F%2Foctel.alt.ac.uk%2F2014%2Fgroups%2Fpaul-is-looking-for-participants-activity-0-2-small-group-reflection%2Fnotifications%2F] c.collis [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__445&utm_campaign=2014-05-06T05:00:10+00:00/members/c-collis/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__445&utm_campaign=2014-05-06T05:00:10+00:00] posted a new activity comment: at 7:03 am, May 5, 2014 

	As a result of thinking that through, I’ve come up with one new initiative: I’m going to invite one of the Learning Designers to attend each of my department’s monthly departmental meetings. The LD will have a standing agenda item each month: s/he will either give an update about a piece of tech that is working particularly well in our areas at the moment, and/or take questions from academic staff about tech ideas they have. Could be a neat way to bridge the sometimes gap between techs and academics, a way to get us working together. – View [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__445&utm_campaign=2014-05-06T05:00:10+00:00/activity/p//?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__445&utm_campaign=2014-05-06T05:00:10+00:00] You have received this message because you are subscribed to receive a digest of activity in some of your groups on ocTEL 2014. 

	To disable these notifications per group please login and go to: My Groups [http://octel.alt.ac.uk/2014?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__445&utm_campaign=2014-05-06T05:00:10+00:00/members/cwrycraft/groups/?utm_source=mailpress&utm_medium=email_link&utm_content=__445&utm_campaign=2014-05-06T05:00:10+00:00] where you can change your email settings for each group.
